summary: This bill, the Providing Real-World Education and Clinical Experience by Precepting Tomorrow’s Nurses Act (PRECEPT Nurses Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to create a tax credit for nurse preceptors. Eligible nurse preceptors, those working at least 200 hours in health professional shortage areas, can receive a $2,000 tax credit. The bill defines key terms, specifies reporting requirements, and sets a termination date of December 31, 2032. It also mandates a Treasury report and an evaluation of the credit's effectiveness.
